abstract: South Korean prostitute Kim Jeong-mi has filed lawsuit challenging South Korea's law requiring state to root out prostitution, in effort to have practice legalized and regulated; suit, which follows landmark decision to decriminalize adultery, comes during time of changing attitudes toward sex but has nonetheless met resistance.
lead_paragraph: The case follows a landmark decision that decriminalized adultery, and reflects continuing changes in the nation’s social attitudes toward sex.

headline.main: Suit Has South Korea Looking Anew at Its Hard Line on Prostitution
headline.print_headline: Suit Has South Korea Looking Anew at Its Hard Line on Prostitution

snippet: The case follows a landmark decision that decriminalized adultery, and reflects continuing changes in the nation’s social attitudes toward sex.
